performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: Jerry's on fire!
Stellar. No screeching from Donna is nice too, altho she dose make some strange noise at one point like a pelican giving birth or something

performances.venue: Adams Field House, U of Montana Missoula, MT
performances.description: Nice stand alone.  Keith is very creative on the organ, dig it man!
Wait for the ending...
The jamming in this version is outstanding. What an epic run of shows for the pre-retirement run..
this is some great melodic soloing by Jerry; he takes all the time the song needs
spacey cool jam that meanders into Estimated
Unusual and fiery version making up the meat of an otherworldly Playin' sandwich.
Short but high octane version with Billy and Jerry crushing it...the jam rises to a furious climax!
A fantasticly jazzed out version, Garica's long slithering solo is the longest to date...
Jerry is like Muhammad Ali here...Phil is, of course, right on point and all over the place...Kieth is ultra funky, Billy K kicks,Weir is tasty
No clean SBD on archive but at official Dead site a pristine version was on 30 days of Dead for DL. 2d best stand-alone I've heard next to 3-20-77
A great standalone version. Really nice jamming
Short succint and distilled to its '74 essence. Plus Donna's sexiest "Ohhhhhhhhh" ever.
Nice standalone fun jam in the middle!
Interesting take here - space jamming, Donna cooing, cowbell work...
Some funky bass be-bop and beautiful chaos in order in chaos in the outro jams. Just exactly perfect.
Nice long Scarlet with out its recently paired partner instead this fuky version moves into a bice Dancin in the Streets, Funky way to start set 2
Jam into GDTRFB, and Fire never catches. What does catch is killer. The post-Scarlet jam rules. Donna is spooky.
Flawless Scarlet! Must Listen! A+
Epic show opener (I mean how many Scarlet OPENERS were there really?!) and a ton 'o fun!!!
Stellar piece of a phenomenal first set...each member is on top of their game
Sadly nobody has posted any stand alone Scarlets,,,this ONE is worthy of full attention
Awesome early version. Jerry has a great solo at the end.
Phil brings the nasty funk
First ever Scarlet Begonias. Very unusual sound with a very tentative, bluesy feel, but it's still a keeper and worth hearing for the novelty at least
EPIC Sugar Mag->Scarlet seamless transition! Like one big song. Phil and Jer are on fire!
Starts slow and builds with energy.  Solo is explosive, bold and relentless!  Jam drifts into Eyes of the World!
Everything's perfect and beautiful in this one.  Can we just say "All Scarlets from Summer '74 are epically heady", cause I don't know a bad one.
Dick's Picks 7 - opening track - groovy baby
Just insane playing on this one...cocaine jazz!!!
Garica's solos are inventive and unique...this version is so tight yet the jams seem to stretch forever!
Great stand alone Scarlet before it found it's life partner in fire. Memorable show, surprising not to see it here.

performances.venue: Iowa State Fairgrounds Des Moines, IA
performances.description: One of the best stand-alone versions IMO, this one gets quite extended for such an early version, with a jam that flows and peaks.

performances.venue: Robertson Gym, UC Santa Barbara Goleta, CA
performances.description: How is this not listed? Perfection!!
Fantastic 15+ minutes of standa-lone Scarlet featuring a very Phil-front bass section post-lyrics. Final jam section gets real jazzy, too.
Morphs out of Sugar Mag, skips the "Aint nothin' wrong" verse and gets right to the solo; clean vid/ fun times
BOUNCY
The notes from Garcia's solo bounce around that centuries old hall like pinballs shot from cannon
Quite interesting jamming throughout!
Real nice stand alone Phil is playing his lines with an extra bit of flair, Jerry is crisp vocally and with the ax, fantastic stand alone Scarlet
Perhaps not the best, but has great psychedelic dripping at the end
Scarlet scrambled eggs deconstructed and elemental. Fun and Jerry is on fire, but we can't say 'flawless'. Chaotic fun. Band's just warming up....
Tight version; jam has bounce, pizzaz, and energy spilling all over the place...these '74 Scarlets are a breed all their own!
Very tight, uptempo and deeply grooving. Check out Seamons' matrix for right tape speed.  Even Donna's contributino is solid on this one.

performances.venue: Campus Stadium, UCSB Santa Barbara, CA
performances.description: Great early version, Donna and Jer are on. Sorry my version sounds like they played in a tin can, though.
Very Jammy stand alone Scarlet, Hot jams throughout tons of Phil and Keith and Donna nice space jam.
So many great stand-alone Scarlets in '76, but this one, from the Download Series Vol. 4, deserves a mention.
Fun and enthusiastic, if not just a little loose in the joints.  Good energy and a great show all around.
Nice 12 min stand-alone into Truckin'.
THis show used to be held in much higher esteem real fun stand alone Scarlet just before CC joins them onstage.
Super fine chilled out rendition.

performances.venue: Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum Stadium Oakland, CA
performances.description: View from the Vault IV. A fantastic standalone "Scarlet" coming out of a hot "Hell in a Bucket."

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Hot show opening duo of Touch into Scarlet Begonias, gets the energy flowing.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Part of scarlet touch fire sequence legendary dark star encore show
BANG! Smoking Scarlet from Jerry this night fast and throwing ACES!

performances.venue: Silva Hall at the Hult Center Eugene, OR
performances.description: Scarlet->Touch->Women R Smarter from a stellar 1984 show. Real interesting heady sequence.
A unique, interesting version due to the "china white". Has an almost country flavor with what sounds like a lot of slide guitar. A cool jam for sure.
Nice transition into Touch of Grey
Scarlet>Victim>Fire>Truckin>Drums>Space>Playin(Reprise)>Standing on the Moon>Good Lovin= Awesome
Nice Scarlet > Bucket.
Good strong instruments, and vocals sound pretty good. Nice jams. A good version.

performances.venue: Greek Theatre, U. Of California Berkeley, CA
performances.description: Amazing jam, heavy Phil and if you hear the board check out the 'Bobby guitar echo' at the very beginning!
Awesome Estimated>Scarlet>Crazy
Great standalone sandwiched between a Sugar Mag and her Sunshine Daydream.  Nice combo.
From Phil's opening swoops to Jerry's passion-vox, and pristine soloing, this is a killer stand alone SB. Surprised it's not here yet.
Epic slow-burning funk. Gets better as it goes, and as Garica gets louder in the mix...one of my favorite stand alones!
2nd Set opened with a short Space into Scarlet high energy cool transition into Touch.

performances.venue: Park West Ski Resort Park City, UT
performances.description: A hidden gem, fantastic solo by Jerry
beautiful solo jerry goes crazy and put me in complete awe
Jerry rips through 5 processions of the 10 bar phrase. Have not heard anything like it in all my listening. Will not disappoint, ending tremelo is nut
1984 audience only standalone Scarlet (touch) at Red Rocks. Great solo, excellent transition.
sometimes you find a diamond in the rough!
Confident stand alone set 2 opener. Loads of Brent and Phil. Phil leads the boys nicely into touch of grey.
very long spacey intro, the star of its pairing with fire on this night
Nice Bucket->Scarlet Women r Smarter. From Shoreline

performances.venue: Madison Square Garden New York, NY
performances.description: Garcia's Jam is crisp and on fire..
Very beautiful, almost sparse playing on this one. It's different than most from '74 but it works.
This one belongs here too. This is not a stand-alone rendition, but the solo hits a mind-blowing peak. The transition is good too.
A straight ahead stand alone rocker. Sweet SM->Scarlet->Estimated sequence. Full band effort.
Intriguing Set 2 opener "Scarlet -> Sugar." Nice MIDI at the end.
Good standalone. But we get a Scarlet->Samson, great stuff.
From a Keith and Donna show but still belongs here - Jerry on lead vocals with a nice drum break from Billy and awesome vocals from Donna
Early Bruce show and he really raises Jerry's game
Launch off on an incredible journey. You will be a different person when you find yourself on the other side.
